items.title: Glitch Portrait Series
items.alt: Self-portrait with intentional digital artifacts, face partially dissolved into color bands

items.title: On Refusal
items.excerpt: To glitch is to refuse the terms of legibility that the system demands...
items.content:
To glitch is to refuse the terms of legibility that the system demands. The error is not failure but resistance—a body that will not be parsed, a signal that refuses clarity.

Legacy Russell writes that the glitch "celebrates failure as a generative force." But what does it mean to fail on purpose? To make oneself unreadable?

The glitch is not chaos. It is a different order, one that the machine cannot process and therefore cannot contain.

items.title: Boundary Notes
items.excerpt: The membrane is not a wall. It is a living surface, selectively permeable...
items.content:
The membrane is not a wall. It is a living surface, selectively permeable, constantly negotiating what passes through.

I've been thinking about thresholds—doorways, windows, skin. The places where inside meets outside, where self meets world. These are not static boundaries but dynamic interfaces.

items.title: drift.01
items.notes: Field recording from the threshold between sleep and waking, processed through granular synthesis.

items.title: Garden
items.description: A personal knowledge management app built with Tauri. Curated blocks of text, images, and links organized by channels.

items.title: Strudel Sketches
items.description: Collection of live coding patterns using Strudel.js. Explorations in algorithmic rhythm and texture.

items.title: Membrane Study
items.alt: Close-up of soap bubble surface showing iridescent interference patterns

items.title: Frequency Notes
items.excerpt: What does it mean to listen at the edges? Where signal dissolves into noise...
items.content:
What does it mean to listen at the edges? Where signal dissolves into noise, where meaning frays into texture.

I've been working with frequencies at the threshold of audibility—sounds that are felt as much as heard. The body becomes the instrument of perception.

items.title: Hydra Patches
items.description: Visual feedback loops and glitch patterns in Hydra. Real-time video synthesis exploring chromatic aberration and signal decay.
